rows.arabic: الٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
rows.translation: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verse of the Scripture that maketh plain.
rows.transliteration: alif lām rā ۚ tilka āyātul kitābil mubīn

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَٰنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: Lo! We have revealed it, a Lecture in Arabic, that ye may understand.
rows.transliteration: innā anzalnāhu qur-ānan `arabiyyal la`allakum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: نَحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ أَحْسَنَ ٱلْقَصَصِ بِمَآ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ لَمِنَ ٱلْغَـٰفِلِينَ
rows.translation: We narrate unto thee (Muhammad) the best of narratives in that We have inspired in thee this Qur'an, though aforetime thou wast of the heedless.
rows.transliteration: naḥnu naquṣṣu `alayka aḥsanal qaṣaṣi bimā awḥaynā ilayka hādhal qur-āna wa in kunta min qablihi laminal ghāfilīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ يُوسُفُ لِأَبِيهِ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّى رَأَيْتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوْكَبًا وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ رَأَيْتُهُمْ لِى سَـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: When Joseph said unto his father: O my father! Lo! I saw in a dream eleven planets and the sun and the moon, I saw them prostrating themselves unto me.
rows.transliteration: idh qāla yūsufu li-abīhi yā-abati innī ra-aytu aḥada `ashara kawkaban wash shamsa wal qamara ra-aytuhum lī sājidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ لَا تَقْصُصْ رُءْيَاكَ عَلَىٰٓ إِخْوَتِكَ فَيَكِيدُوا۟ لَكَ كَيْدًا ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: He said: O my dear son! Tell not thy brethren of thy vision, lest they plot a plot against thee. Lo! Satan is for man an open foe.
rows.transliteration: qāla yābunayya lā taqṣuṣ ru-yāka `alā ikhwatika fayakīdū laka kaydā ۖ innash shayṭāna lilinsāni `aduwwun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَجْتَبِيكَ رَبُّكَ وَيُعَلِّمُكَ مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ وَيُتِمُّ نِعْمَتَهُۥ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَىٰٓ ءَالِ يَعْقُوبَ كَمَآ أَتَمَّهَا عَلَىٰٓ أَبَوَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: Thus thy Lord will prefer thee and will teach thee the interpretation of events, and will perfect His grace upon thee and upon the family of Jacob as He perfected it upon thy forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Lo! thy Lord is Knower, Wise.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika yajtabīka rabbuka wayu`allimuka min ta-wīlil-aḥādīthi wayutimmu ni`matahu `alayka wa`alā āli ya`qūba kamā atammahā `alā abawayka min qablu ibrāhīma wa is-ḥāq ۚ inna rabbaka `alīmun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: لَّقَدْ كَانَ فِى يُوسُفَ وَإِخْوَتِهِۦٓ ءَايَـٰتٌ لِّلسَّآئِلِينَ
rows.translation: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (of Allah's Sovereignty) for the inquiring.
rows.transliteration: laqad kāna fī yūsufa wa ikhwatihi āyātul lissā-ilīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالُوا۟ لَيُوسُفُ وَأَخُوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَبِينَا مِنَّا وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبَانَا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: When they said: Verily Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, many though we be. Lo! our father is in plain aberration.
rows.transliteration: idh qālū layūsufu wa-akhūhu aḥabbu ilā abīnā minnā wanaḥnu `uṣbatun inna abānā lafī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.arabic: ٱقْتُلُوا۟ يُوسُفَ أَوِ ٱطْرَحُوهُ أَرْضًا يَخْلُ لَكُمْ وَجْهُ أَبِيكُمْ وَتَكُونُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ قَوْمًا صَـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: (One said): Kill Joseph or cast him to some (other) land, so that your father's favour may be all for you, and (that) ye may afterward be righteous folk.
rows.transliteration: uqtulū yūsufa awiṭ-raḥūhu arḍan yakhlu lakum wajhu abīkum watakūnū min ba`dihi qawman ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ لَا تَقْتُلُوا۟ يُوسُفَ وَأَلْقُوهُ فِى غَيَـٰبَتِ ٱلْجُبِّ يَلْتَقِطْهُ بَعْضُ ٱلسَّيَّارَةِ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
rows.translation: One among them said: Kill not Joseph but, if ye must be doing, fling him into the depth of the pit; some caravan will find him.
rows.transliteration: qāla qā-ilun minhum lā taqtulū yūsufa wa-alqūhu fī ghayābatil jubbi yaltaqiṭ-hu ba`ḍus sayyārati in kuntum fā`ilīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا مَا لَكَ لَا تَأْمَ۫نَّا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَنَـٰصِحُونَ
rows.translation: They said: O our father! Why wilt thou not trust us with Joseph, when lo! we are good friends to him?
rows.transliteration: qālū yā-abānā mā laka lā ta-mannā `alā yūsufa wa innā lahu lanāṣiḥūn

rows.arabic: أَرْسِلْهُ مَعَنَا غَدًا يَرْتَعْ وَيَلْعَبْ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
rows.translation: Send him with us to-morrow that he may enjoy himself and play. And lo! we shall take good care of him.
rows.transliteration: arsilhu ma`anā ghadan yarta` wayal`ab wa innā lahu laḥāfiẓūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّى لَيَحْزُنُنِىٓ أَن تَذْهَبُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَأَخَافُ أَن يَأْكُلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ وَأَنتُمْ عَنْهُ غَـٰفِلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: Lo! in truth it saddens me that ye should take him with you, and I fear less the wolf devour him while ye are heedless of him.
rows.transliteration: qāla innī layaḥzununī an tadh-habū bihi wa-akhāfu an ya-kulahudh dhi-bu wa-antum `anhu ghāfilūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِنْ أَكَلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: They said: If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band, then surely we should have already perished.
rows.transliteration: qālū la-in akalahudh dhi-bu wanaḥnu `uṣbatun innā idhal lakhāsirūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا ذَهَبُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَأَجْمَعُوٓا۟ أَن يَجْعَلُوهُ فِى غَيَـٰبَتِ ٱلْجُبِّ ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Then, when they led him off, and were of one mind that they should place him in the depth of the pit, We inspired in him: Thou wilt tell them of this deed of theirs when they know (thee) not.
rows.transliteration: falammā dhahabū bihi wa-ajma`ū an yaj`alūhu fī ghayābatil jubb ۚ wa-awḥaynā ilayhi latunabbi-annahum bi-amrihim hādhā wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: وَجَآءُوٓ أَبَاهُمْ عِشَآءً يَبْكُونَ
rows.translation: And they came weeping to their father in the evening.
rows.transliteration: wajā-ū abāhum `ishā-an yabkūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَآ إِنَّا ذَهَبْنَا نَسْتَبِقُ وَتَرَكْنَا يُوسُفَ عِندَ مَتَـٰعِنَا فَأَكَلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِمُؤْمِنٍ لَّنَا وَلَوْ كُنَّا صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Saying: O our father! We went racing one with another, and left Joseph by our things, and the wolf devoured him, and thou believest not our saying even when we speak the truth.
rows.transliteration: qālū yā-abānā innā dhahabnā nastabiqu wataraknā yūsufa `inda matā`inā fa-akalahudh dhi-b ۖ wa mā anta bimu-minin lanā walaw kunnā ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: وَجَآءُو عَلَىٰ قَمِيصِهِۦ بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ ۚ قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًا ۖ فَصَبْرٌ جَمِيلٌ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: And they came with false blood on his shirt. He said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience. And Allah it is Whose help is to be sought in that (predicament) which ye describe.
rows.transliteration: wajā-ū `alā qamīṣihi bidamin kadhib ۚ qāla bal sawwalat lakum anfusukum amrā ۖ faṣabrun jamīl ۖ wallāhul musta`ānu `alā mā taṣifūn

rows.arabic: وَجَآءَتْ سَيَّارَةٌ فَأَرْسَلُوا۟ وَارِدَهُمْ فَأَدْلَىٰ دَلْوَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ يَـٰبُشْرَىٰ هَـٰذَا غُلَـٰمٌ ۚ وَأَسَرُّوهُ بِضَـٰعَةً ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And there came a caravan, and they sent their waterdrawer. He let down his pail (into the pit). He said: Good luck! Here is a youth. And they hid him as a treasure, and Allah was Aware of what they did.
rows.transliteration: wajā-at sayyāratun fa-arsalū wāridahum fa-adlā dalwah ۖ qāla yābushrā hādhā ghulām ۚ wa-asarrūhu biḍā`ah ۚ wallāhu `alīmun bimā ya`malūn

rows.arabic: وَشَرَوْهُ بِثَمَنٍۭ بَخْسٍ دَرَٰهِمَ مَعْدُودَةٍ وَكَانُوا۟ فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلزَّٰهِدِينَ
rows.translation: And they sold him for a low price, a number of silver coins; and they attached no value to him.
rows.transliteration: washarawhu bithamanin bakhsin darāhima ma`dūdatin wakānū fīhi minaz zāhidīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِى ٱشْتَرَىٰهُ مِن مِّصْرَ لِٱمْرَأَتِهِۦٓ أَكْرِمِى مَثْوَىٰهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُۥ مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَالِبٌ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِۦ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And he of Egypt who purchased him said unto his wife: Receive him honourably. Perchance he may prove useful to us or we may adopt him as a son. Thus we established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah was predominant in His career, but most of mankind know not.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhish-tarāhu min miṣra līmra-atihi akrimī mathwāhu `asā an yanfa`anā aw nattakhidhahu waladā ۚ wakadhālika makkannā liyūsufa fil-arḍi walinu`allimahu min ta-wīlil-aḥādīth ۚ wallāhu ghālibun `alā amrihi walākinna aktharan nāsi lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُۥٓ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: And And when he reached his prime We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus We reward the good.
rows.transliteration: walammā balagha ashuddahu ātaynāhu ḥukman wa`il-mā ۚ wakadhālika najzil muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: وَرَٰوَدَتْهُ ٱلَّتِى هُوَ فِى بَيْتِهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ وَغَلَّقَتِ ٱلْأَبْوَٰبَ وَقَالَتْ هَيْتَ لَكَ ۚ قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَحْسَنَ مَثْوَاىَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And she, in whose house he was, asked of him an evil act. She bolted the doors and said: Come! He said: I seek refuge in Allah! Lo! he is my lord, who hath treated me honourably. Lo! wrong-doers never prosper.
rows.transliteration: warāwadat-hul latī huwa fī baytihā `an nafsihi waghallaqatil-abwāba waqālat hayta lak ۚ qāla ma`ādhallāh ۖ innahu rabbī aḥsana mathwāy ۖ innahu lā yufliḥuẓ ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ هَمَّتْ بِهِۦ ۖ وَهَمَّ بِهَا لَوْلَآ أَن رَّءَا بُرْهَـٰنَ رَبِّهِۦ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنَصْرِفَ عَنْهُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَٱلْفَحْشَآءَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
rows.translation: She verily desired him, and he would have desired her if it had not been that he saw the argument of his Lord. Thus it was, that We might ward off from him evil and lewdness. Lo! he was of Our chosen slaves.
rows.transliteration: walaqad hammat bih ۖ wahamma bihā lawlā an ra-ā burhāna rabbih ۚ kadhālika linaṣrifa `anhus sū a wal faḥshā-a ۚ innahu min `ibādinal mukhlaṣīn

rows.arabic: وَٱسْتَبَقَا ٱلْبَابَ وَقَدَّتْ قَمِيصَهُۥ مِن دُبُرٍ وَأَلْفَيَا سَيِّدَهَا لَدَا ٱلْبَابِ ۚ قَالَتْ مَا جَزَآءُ مَنْ أَرَادَ بِأَهْلِكَ سُوٓءًا إِلَّآ أَن يُسْجَنَ أَوْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: And they raced with one another to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they met her lord and master at the door. She said: What shall be his reward, who wisheth evil to thy folk, save prison or a painful doom?
rows.transliteration: wastabaqal bāba waqaddat qamīṣahu min duburin wa-alfayā sayyidahā ladal bāb ۚ qālat mā jazā-u man arāda bi-ahlika sū-an illā an yusjana aw `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ هِىَ رَٰوَدَتْنِى عَن نَّفْسِى ۚ وَشَهِدَ شَاهِدٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَآ إِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍ فَصَدَقَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: (Joseph) said: She it was who asked of me an evil act. And a witness of her own folk testified: If his shirt is torn from before, then she speaketh truth and he is of the liars.
rows.transliteration: qāla hiya rāwadatnī `an nafsī ۚ washahida shāhidun min ahlihā in kāna qamīṣuhu qudda min qubulin faṣadaqat wahuwa minal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ فَكَذَبَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then she hath lied and he is of the truthful.
rows.transliteration: wa in kāna qamīṣuhu qudda min duburin fakadhabat wahuwa minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَءَا قَمِيصَهُۥ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ مِن كَيْدِكُنَّ ۖ إِنَّ كَيْدَكُنَّ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: So when he saw his shirt torn from behind, he said: Lo! this is of the guile of you women. Lo! the guile of you is very great.
rows.transliteration: falammā ra-ā qamīṣahu qudda min duburin qāla innahu min kaydikunn ۖ inna kaydakunna `aẓīm

rows.arabic: يُوسُفُ أَعْرِضْ عَنْ هَـٰذَا ۚ وَٱسْتَغْفِرِى لِذَنۢبِكِ ۖ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ ٱلْخَاطِـِٔينَ
rows.translation: O Joseph! Turn away from this, and thou, (O woman), ask forgiveness for thy sin. Lo! thou art of the faulty.
rows.transliteration: yūsufu a`riḍ `an hādhā ۚ wastaghfirī lidhanbik ۖ innaki kunti minal khāṭi-īn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ نِسْوَةٌ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ ٱمْرَأَتُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ تُرَٰوِدُ فَتَىٰهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۖ قَدْ شَغَفَهَا حُبًّا ۖ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰهَا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: And women in the city said: The ruler's wife is asking of her slave-boy an ill-deed. Indeed he has smitten her to the heart with love. We behold her in plain aberration.
rows.transliteration: waqāla niswatun fil madīnatim-ra-atul `azīzi turāwidu fatāhā `an nafsih ۖ qad shaghafahā ḥubbā ۖ innā lanarāhā fī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا سَمِعَتْ بِمَكْرِهِنَّ أَرْسَلَتْ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَعْتَدَتْ لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَـًٔا وَءَاتَتْ كُلَّ وَٰحِدَةٍ مِّنْهُنَّ سِكِّينًا وَقَالَتِ ٱخْرُجْ عَلَيْهِنَّ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَيْنَهُۥٓ أَكْبَرْنَهُۥ وَقَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلْنَ حَـٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا هَـٰذَا بَشَرًا إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا مَلَكٌ كَرِيمٌ
rows.translation: And when she heard of their sly talk, she sent to them and prepared for them a cushioned couch (to lie on at the feast) and gave to every one of them a knife and said (to Joseph): Come out unto them! And when they saw him they exalted him and cut their hands, exclaiming: Allah Blameless! This is no a human being. This is not other than some gracious angel.
rows.transliteration: falammā sami`at bimakrihinna arsalat ilayhinna wa-a`tadat lahunna muttaka-an wa-ātat kulla wāḥidatim minhunna sikkīnan waqālatikh-ruj `alayhinn ۖ falammā ra-aynahu akbarnahu waqaṭṭa`na aydiyahunna waqulna ḥāsha lillāhi mā hādhā basharan in hādhā illā malakun karīm

rows.arabic: قَالَتْ فَذَٰلِكُنَّ ٱلَّذِى لُمْتُنَّنِى فِيهِ ۖ وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدتُّهُۥ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ فَٱسْتَعْصَمَ ۖ وَلَئِن لَّمْ يَفْعَلْ مَآ ءَامُرُهُۥ لَيُسْجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكُونًا مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰغِرِينَ
rows.translation: She said: This is he on whose account ye blamed me. I asked of him an evil act, but he proved continent, but if he do not my behest he verily shall be imprisoned, and verily shall be of those brought low.
rows.transliteration: qālat fadhālikunnal ladhī lumtunnanī fīh ۖ walaqad rāwadtuhu `an nafsihi fasta`ṣam ۖ wala-in lam yaf`al mā āmuruhu layusjananna walayakūnan minaṣ ṣāghirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱلسِّجْنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىَّ مِمَّا يَدْعُونَنِىٓ إِلَيْهِ ۖ وَإِلَّا تَصْرِفْ عَنِّى كَيْدَهُنَّ أَصْبُ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
rows.translation: He said: O my Lord! Prison is more dear than that unto which they urge me, and if Thou fend not off their wiles from me I shall incline unto them and become of the foolish.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbis sijnu aḥabbu ilayya mimmā yad`ūnanī ilayh ۖ wa illā taṣrif `annī kaydahunna aṣbu ilayhinna wa-akun minal jāhilīn

rows.arabic: فَٱسْتَجَابَ لَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥ فَصَرَفَ عَنْهُ كَيْدَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: So his Lord heard his prayer and fended off their wiles from him. Lo! He is Hearer, Knower.
rows.transliteration: fastajāba lahu rabbuhu faṣarafa `anhu kaydahunn ۚ innahu huwas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ بَدَا لَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا رَأَوُا۟ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَيَسْجُنُنَّهُۥ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: And it seemed good to them (the men-folk) after they had seen the signs (of his innocence) to imprison him for a time.
rows.transliteration: thumma badā lahum min ba`di mā ra-awul-āyāti layasjununnahu ḥattā ḥīn

rows.arabic: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ ٱلسِّجْنَ فَتَيَانِ ۖ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَآ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰنِىٓ أَعْصِرُ خَمْرًا ۖ وَقَالَ ٱلْـَٔاخَرُ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰنِىٓ أَحْمِلُ فَوْقَ رَأْسِى خُبْزًا تَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّيْرُ مِنْهُ ۖ نَبِّئْنَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦٓ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَىٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: And two young men went to prison with him. One of them said: I dreamed that I was pressing wine. The other said: I dreamed that I was carrying upon my head bread whereof the birds were eating. Announce unto us the interpretation, for we see thee of those good (at interpretation).
rows.transliteration: wadakhala ma`ahus sijna fatayān ۖ qāla aḥaduhumā innī arānī a`ṣiru khamrā ۖ waqālal-ākharu innī arānī aḥmilu fawqa ra-sī khubzan ta-kuluṭ ṭayru minh ۖ nabbi-nā bita-wīlih ۖ innā narāka minal muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَا يَأْتِيكُمَا طَعَامٌ تُرْزَقَانِهِۦٓ إِلَّا نَبَّأْتُكُمَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتِيَكُمَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمَا مِمَّا عَلَّمَنِى رَبِّىٓ ۚ إِنِّى تَرَكْتُ مِلَّةَ قَوْمٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: He said: The food which ye are given (daily) shall not come unto you but I shall tell you the interpretation ere it cometh unto you. This is of that which my Lord hath taught me. Lo! I have forsaken the religion of folk who believe not in Allah and are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
rows.transliteration: qāla lā ya-tīkumā ṭa`āmun turzaqānihi illā nabba-tukumā bita-wīlihi qabla an ya-tiyakumā ۚ dhālikumā mimmā `allamanī rabbī ۚ innī taraktu millata qawmin lā yu-minūna billāhi wahum bil-ākhirati hum kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّبَعْتُ مِلَّةَ ءَابَآءِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۚ مَا كَانَ لَنَآ أَن نُّشْرِكَ بِٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It never was for us to attribute aught as partner to Allah. This is of the bounty of Allah unto us (the seed of Abraham) and unto mankind; but most men give not thanks.
rows.transliteration: wattaba`tu millata ābā-ī ibrāhīma wa is-ḥāqa waya`qūb ۚ mā kāna lanā an nushrika billāhi min shay-ī ۚ dhālika min faḍlillāhi `alaynā wa`alan nāsi walākinna aktharan nāsi lā yashkurūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰصَـٰحِبَىِ ٱلسِّجْنِ ءَأَرْبَابٌ مُّتَفَرِّقُونَ خَيْرٌ أَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّارُ
rows.translation: O my fellow-prisoners! Are divers lords better, or Allah the One, Almighty?
rows.transliteration: yāṣāḥibayis sijni a-arbābun mutafarriqūna khayrun amillāhul wāḥidul qahhār

rows.arabic: مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءً سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ إِنِ ٱلْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۚ أَمَرَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلْقَيِّمُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Those whom ye worship beside Him are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers. Allah hath revealed no sanction for them. The decision rests with Allah only, Who hath commanded you that ye worship none save Him. This is the right religion, but most men know not.
rows.transliteration: mā ta`budūna min dūnihi illā asmā-an sammaytumūhā antum wa-ābā-ukum mā anzalallāhu bihā min sulṭān ۚ inil ḥukmu illā lillāh ۚ amara allā ta`budū illā iyyāh ۚ dhālikad dīnul qayyimu walākinna aktharan nāsi lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰصَـٰحِبَىِ ٱلسِّجْنِ أَمَّآ أَحَدُكُمَا فَيَسْقِى رَبَّهُۥ خَمْرًا ۖ وَأَمَّا ٱلْـَٔاخَرُ فَيُصْلَبُ فَتَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّيْرُ مِن رَّأْسِهِۦ ۚ قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ تَسْتَفْتِيَانِ
rows.translation: O my two fellow-prisoners! As for one of you, he will pour out wine for his lord to drink; and as for the other, he will be crucified so that the birds will eat from his head. Thus is the case judged concerning which ye did inquire.
rows.transliteration: yāṣāḥibayis sijni ammā aḥadukumā fayasqī rabbahu khamrā ۖ wa-ammal-ākharu fayuṣlabu fata-kuluṭ ṭayru min ra-sih ۚ quḍiyal-amrul ladhī fīhi tastaftiyān

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ لِلَّذِى ظَنَّ أَنَّهُۥ نَاجٍ مِّنْهُمَا ٱذْكُرْنِى عِندَ رَبِّكَ فَأَنسَىٰهُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ ذِكْرَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِى ٱلسِّجْنِ بِضْعَ سِنِينَ
rows.translation: And he said unto him of the twain who he knew would be released: Mention me in the presence of thy lord. But Satan caused him to forget to mention it to his lord, so he (Joseph) stayed in prison for some years.
rows.transliteration: waqāla lilladhī ẓanna annahu nājin minhumadh-kurnī `inda rabbika fa-ansāhush shayṭānu dhikra rabbihi falabitha fis sijni biḍ`a sinīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ سَبْعَ بَقَرَٰتٍ سِمَانٍ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌ وَسَبْعَ سُنۢبُلَـٰتٍ خُضْرٍ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَـٰتٍ ۖ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِى فِى رُءْيَـٰىَ إِن كُنتُمْ لِلرُّءْيَا تَعْبُرُونَ
rows.translation: And the king said: Lo! I saw in a dream seven fat kine which seven lean were eating, and seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry. O notables! Expound for me my vision, if ye can interpret dreams.
rows.transliteration: waqālal-maliku innī arā sab`a baqarātin simāniy ya-kuluhunna sab`un `ijāfun wasab`a sunbulātin khuḍrin wa-ukhara yābisāt ۖ yā-ayyuhal mala-u aftūnī fī ru-yāya in kuntum lirru-iyā ta`burūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَضْغَـٰثُ أَحْلَـٰمٍ ۖ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِتَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحْلَـٰمِ بِعَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: They answered: Jumbled dreams! And we are not knowing in the interpretation of dreams.
rows.transliteration: qālū aḍghāthu aḥlām ۖ wa mā naḥnu bita-wīlil-aḥlāmi bi`ālimīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِى نَجَا مِنْهُمَا وَٱدَّكَرَ بَعْدَ أُمَّةٍ أَنَا۠ أُنَبِّئُكُم بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ فَأَرْسِلُونِ
rows.translation: And he of the two who was released, and (now) at length remembered, said: I am going to announce unto you the interpretation, therefore send me forth.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhī najā minhumā waddakara ba`da ummatin ana unabbi-ukum bita-wīlihi fa-arsilūn

rows.arabic: يُوسُفُ أَيُّهَا ٱلصِّدِّيقُ أَفْتِنَا فِى سَبْعِ بَقَرَٰتٍ سِمَانٍ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌ وَسَبْعِ سُنۢبُلَـٰتٍ خُضْرٍ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَـٰتٍ لَّعَلِّىٓ أَرْجِعُ إِلَى ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: (And when he came to Joseph in the prison, he exclaimed): Joseph! O thou truthful one! Expound for us the seven fat kine which seven lean were eating and the seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry, that I may return unto the people, so that they may know.
rows.transliteration: yūsufu ayyuhaṣ ṣiddīqu aftinā fī sab`i baqarātin simāniy ya-kuluhunna sab`un `ijāfun wasab`i sunbulātin khuḍrin wa-ukhara yābisātin la`allī arji`u ilan nāsi la`allahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ تَزْرَعُونَ سَبْعَ سِنِينَ دَأَبًا فَمَا حَصَدتُّمْ فَذَرُوهُ فِى سُنۢبُلِهِۦٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: Ye shall sow seven years as usual, but that which ye reap, leave it in the ear, all save a little which ye eat.
rows.transliteration: qāla tazra`ūna sab`a sinīna da-aban famā ḥaṣadtum fadharūhu fī sunbulihi illā qalīlan mimmā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ سَبْعٌ شِدَادٌ يَأْكُلْنَ مَا قَدَّمْتُمْ لَهُنَّ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّمَّا تُحْصِنُونَ
rows.translation: Then after that will come seven hard years which will devour all that ye have prepared for them, save a little of that which ye have stored.
rows.transliteration: thumma ya-tī min ba`di dhālika sab`un shidādun ya-kulna mā qaddamtum lahunna illā qalīlan mimmā tuḥṣinūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ عَامٌ فِيهِ يُغَاثُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَفِيهِ يَعْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: Then, after that, will come a year when the people will have plenteous crops and when they will press (wine and oil).
rows.transliteration: thumma ya-tī min ba`di dhālika `āmun fīhi yughāthun nāsu wafīhi ya`ṣirūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱئْتُونِى بِهِۦ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُ ٱلرَّسُولُ قَالَ ٱرْجِعْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَسْـَٔلْهُ مَا بَالُ ٱلنِّسْوَةِ ٱلَّـٰتِى قَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى بِكَيْدِهِنَّ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: And the king said: Bring him unto me. And when the messenger came unto him, he (Joseph) said: Return unto thy lord and ask him what was the case of the women who cut their hands. Lo! my Lord knoweth their guile.
rows.transliteration: waqālal-maliku-tūnī bih ۖ falammā jā-ahur rasūlu qālar-ji` ilā rabbika fas-alhu mā bālun niswatil lātī qaṭṭa`na aydiyahunn ۚ inna rabbī bikaydihinna `alīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُنَّ إِذْ رَٰوَدتُّنَّ يُوسُفَ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۚ قُلْنَ حَـٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا عَلِمْنَا عَلَيْهِ مِن سُوٓءٍ ۚ قَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ حَصْحَصَ ٱلْحَقُّ أَنَا۠ رَٰوَدتُّهُۥ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: He (the king) (then sent for those women and) said: What happened when ye asked an evil act of Joseph? They answered: Allah Blameless! We know no evil of him. Said the wife of the ruler: Now the truth is out. I asked of him an evil act, and he is surely of the truthful.
rows.transliteration: qāla mā khaṭbukunna idh rāwadtunna yūsufa `an nafsih ۚ qulna ḥāsha lillāhi mā `alimnā `alayhi min sū-ī ۚ qālatim-ra-atul `azīzil-āna ḥaṣ-ḥaṣal ḥaqqu ana rāwadtuhu `an nafsihi wa innahu laminaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ لِيَعْلَمَ أَنِّى لَمْ أَخُنْهُ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى كَيْدَ ٱلْخَآئِنِينَ
rows.translation: (Then Joseph said: I asked for) this, that he (my lord) may know that I betrayed him not in secret, and that surely Allah guideth not the snare of the betrayers.
rows.transliteration: dhālika liya`lama annī lam akhunhu bil ghaybi wa-annallāha lā yahdī kaydal khā-inīn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أُبَرِّئُ نَفْسِىٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلنَّفْسَ لَأَمَّارَةٌۢ بِٱلسُّوٓءِ إِلَّا مَا رَحِمَ رَبِّىٓ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: I do not exculpate myself. Lo! the (human) soul enjoineth unto evil, save that whereon my Lord hath mercy. Lo! my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ubarri-u nafsī ۚ innan nafsa la-ammāratun bis sū-i illā mā raḥima rabbī ۚ inna rabbī ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱئْتُونِى بِهِۦٓ أَسْتَخْلِصْهُ لِنَفْسِى ۖ فَلَمَّا كَلَّمَهُۥ قَالَ إِنَّكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ لَدَيْنَا مَكِينٌ أَمِينٌ
rows.translation: And the king said: Bring him unto me that I may attach him to my person. And when he had talked with him he said: Lo! thou art to-day in our presence established and trusted.
rows.transliteration: waqālal-maliku-tūnī bihi astakhliṣ-hu linafsī ۖ falammā kallamahu qāla innakal yawma ladaynā makīnun amīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱجْعَلْنِى عَلَىٰ خَزَآئِنِ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنِّى حَفِيظٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land. Lo! I am a skilled custodian.
rows.transliteration: qālaj-`alnī `alā khazā-inil-arḍ ۖ innī ḥafīẓun `alīm

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَتَبَوَّأُ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ يَشَآءُ ۚ نُصِيبُ بِرَحْمَتِنَا مَن نَّشَآءُ ۖ وَلَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: Thus gave We power to Joseph in the land. He was the owner of it where he pleased. We reach with Our mercy whom We will. We lose not the reward of the good.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika makkannā liyūsufa fil-arḍi yatabawwa-u minhā ḥaythu yashā-u ۚ nuṣību biraḥmatinā man nashā-u ۖ walā nuḍī`u ajral muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: وَلَأَجْرُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: And the reward of the Hereafter is better, for those who believe and ward off (evil).
rows.transliteration: wala-ajrul-ākhirati khayrul lilladhīna āmanū wakānū yattaqūn

rows.arabic: وَجَآءَ إِخْوَةُ يُوسُفَ فَدَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَعَرَفَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
rows.translation: And Joseph's brethren came and presented themselves before him, and he knew them but they knew him not.
rows.transliteration: wajā-a ikhwatu yūsufa fadakhalū `alayhi fa`arafahum wahum lahu munkirūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهَازِهِمْ قَالَ ٱئْتُونِى بِأَخٍ لَّكُم مِّنْ أَبِيكُمْ ۚ أَلَا تَرَوْنَ أَنِّىٓ أُوفِى ٱلْكَيْلَ وَأَنَا۠ خَيْرُ ٱلْمُنزِلِينَ
rows.translation: And when he provided them with their provision he said: Bring unto me a brother of yours from your father. See ye not that I fill up the measure and I am the best of hosts?
rows.transliteration: walammā jahhazahum bijahāzihim qāla-tūnī bi-akhin lakum min abīkum ۚ alā tarawna annī ūfil kayla wa-ana khayrul munzilīn

rows.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ تَأْتُونِى بِهِۦ فَلَا كَيْلَ لَكُمْ عِندِى وَلَا تَقْرَبُونِ
rows.translation: And if ye bring him not unto me, then there shall be no measure for you with me, nor shall ye draw near.
rows.transliteration: fa-in lam ta-tūnī bihi falā kayla lakum `indī walā taqrabūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَنُرَٰوِدُ عَنْهُ أَبَاهُ وَإِنَّا لَفَـٰعِلُونَ
rows.translation: They said: We will try to win him from his father: that we will surely do.
rows.transliteration: qālū sanurāwidu `anhu abāhu wa innā lafā`ilūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ لِفِتْيَـٰنِهِ ٱجْعَلُوا۟ بِضَـٰعَتَهُمْ فِى رِحَالِهِمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَعْرِفُونَهَآ إِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: He said unto his young men: Place their merchandise in their saddlebags, so that they may know it when they go back to their folk, and so will come again.
rows.transliteration: waqāla lifityānihij-`alū biḍā`atahum fī riḥālihim la`allahum ya`rifūnahā idhan-qalabū ilā ahlihim la`allahum yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَجَعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَبِيهِمْ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا مُنِعَ مِنَّا ٱلْكَيْلُ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَآ أَخَانَا نَكْتَلْ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
rows.translation: So when they went back to their father they said: O our father! The measure is denied us, so send with us our brother that we may obtain the measure, surely we will guard him well.
rows.transliteration: falammā raja`ū ilā abīhim qālū yā-abānā muni`a minnal kaylu fa-arsil ma`anā akhānā naktal wa innā lahu laḥāfiẓūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ ءَامَنُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا كَمَآ أَمِنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَخِيهِ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ فَٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌ حَـٰفِظًا ۖ وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
rows.translation: He said: Can I entrust him to you save as I entrusted his brother to you aforetime? Allah is better at guarding, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
rows.transliteration: qāla hal āmanukum `alayhi illā kamā amintukum `alā akhīhi min qabl ۖ fallāhu khayrun ḥāfiẓā ۖ wahuwa arḥamur rāḥimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا فَتَحُوا۟ مَتَـٰعَهُمْ وَجَدُوا۟ بِضَـٰعَتَهُمْ رُدَّتْ إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا مَا نَبْغِى ۖ هَـٰذِهِۦ بِضَـٰعَتُنَا رُدَّتْ إِلَيْنَا ۖ وَنَمِيرُ أَهْلَنَا وَنَحْفَظُ أَخَانَا وَنَزْدَادُ كَيْلَ بَعِيرٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ كَيْلٌ يَسِيرٌ
rows.translation: And when they opened their belongings they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them. They said: O our father! What (more) can we ask? Here is our merchandise returned to us. We shall get provision for our folk and guard our brother, and we shall have the extra measure of a camel (load). This (that we bring now) is a light measure.
rows.transliteration: walammā fataḥū matā`ahum wajadū biḍā`atahum ruddat ilayhim ۖ qālū yā-abānā mā nabghī ۖ hādhihi biḍā`atunā ruddat ilaynā ۖ wanamīru ahlanā wanaḥfaẓu akhānā wanazdādu kayla ba`īr ۖ dhālika kaylun yasīr

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَنْ أُرْسِلَهُۥ مَعَكُمْ حَتَّىٰ تُؤْتُونِ مَوْثِقًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ لَتَأْتُنَّنِى بِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن يُحَاطَ بِكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّآ ءَاتَوْهُ مَوْثِقَهُمْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ
rows.translation: He said: I will not send him with you till ye give me an undertaking in the name of Allah that ye will bring him back to me, unless ye are surrounded. And when they gave him their undertaking he said: Allah is the Warden over what we say.
rows.transliteration: qāla lan ursilahu ma`akum ḥattā tu-tūni mawthiqan minallāhi lata-tunnanī bihi illā an yuḥāṭa bikum ۖ falammā ātawhu mawthiqahum qālallāhu `alā mā naqūlu wakīl

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ يَـٰبَنِىَّ لَا تَدْخُلُوا۟ مِنۢ بَابٍ وَٰحِدٍ وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ مِنْ أَبْوَٰبٍ مُّتَفَرِّقَةٍ ۖ وَمَآ أُغْنِى عَنكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنِ ٱلْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۖ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ ۖ وَعَلَيْهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ
rows.translation: And he said: O my sons! Go not in by one gate; go in by different gates. I can naught avail you as against Allah. Lo! the decision rests with Allah only. In Him do I put my trust, and in Him let all the trusting put their trust.
rows.transliteration: waqāla yābaniyya lā tadkhulū min bābin wāḥidin wadkhulū min abwābin mutafarriqah ۖ wa mā ughnī `ankum minallāhi min shay-ī ۖ inil ḥukmu illā lillāh ۖ `alayhi tawakkalt ۖ wa`alayhi falyatawakkalil mutawakkilūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ مِنْ حَيْثُ أَمَرَهُمْ أَبُوهُم مَّا كَانَ يُغْنِى عَنْهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا حَاجَةً فِى نَفْسِ يَعْقُوبَ قَضَىٰهَا ۚ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَذُو عِلْمٍ لِّمَا عَلَّمْنَـٰهُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And when they entered in the manner which their father had enjoined, it would have naught availed them as against Allah; it was but a need of Jacob's soul which he thus satisfied; and lo! he was a lord of knowledge because We had taught him; but most of mankind know not.
rows.transliteration: walammā dakhalū min ḥaythu amarahum abūhum mā kāna yughnī `anhum minallāhi min shay-in illā ḥājatan fī nafsi ya`qūba qaḍāhā ۚ wa innahu ladhū `il-min limā `allamnāhu walākinna aktharan nāsi lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ ءَاوَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ أَخَاهُ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا۠ أَخُوكَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And when they went in before Joseph, he took his brother unto him, saying: Lo! I, even I, am thy brother, therefore sorrow not for what they did.
rows.transliteration: walammā dakhalū `alā yūsufa āwā ilayhi akhāh ۖ qāla innī ana akhūka falā tabta-is bimā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهَازِهِمْ جَعَلَ ٱلسِّقَايَةَ فِى رَحْلِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ أَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ أَيَّتُهَا ٱلْعِيرُ إِنَّكُمْ لَسَـٰرِقُونَ
rows.translation: And when he provided them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup in his brother's saddlebag, and then a crier cried: O camel-riders! Lo! ye are surely thieves!
rows.transliteration: falammā jahhazahum bijahāzihim ja`alas siqāyata fī raḥli akhīhi thumma adhhana mu-adhhinun ayyatuhal `īru innakum lasāriqūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ وَأَقْبَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم مَّاذَا تَفْقِدُونَ
rows.translation: They cried, coming toward them: What is it ye have lost?
rows.transliteration: qālū wa-aqbalū `alayhim mādhā tafqidūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَفْقِدُ صُوَاعَ ٱلْمَلِكِ وَلِمَن جَآءَ بِهِۦ حِمْلُ بَعِيرٍ وَأَنَا۠ بِهِۦ زَعِيمٌ
rows.translation: They said: We have lost the king's cup, and he who bringeth it shall have a camel-load, and I (said Joseph) am answerable for it.
rows.transliteration: qālū nafqidu ṣuwā`al maliki waliman jā-a bihi ḥimlu ba`īrin wa-ana bihi za`īm

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا جِئْنَا لِنُفْسِدَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كُنَّا سَـٰرِقِينَ
rows.translation: They said: By Allah, well ye know we came not to do evil in the land, and are no thieves.
rows.transliteration: qālū tallāhi laqad `alimtum mā ji-nā linufsida fil-arḍi wa mā kunnā sāriqīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ فَمَا جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥٓ إِن كُنتُمْ كَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: They said: And what shall be the penalty for it, if ye prove liars?
rows.transliteration: qālū famā jazā-uhu in kuntum kādhibīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥ مَن وُجِدَ فِى رَحْلِهِۦ فَهُوَ جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: They said: The penalty for it! He in whose bag (the cup) is found, he is the penalty for it. Thus we requite wrong-doers.
rows.transliteration: qālū jazā-uhu man wujida fī raḥlihi fahuwa jazā-uh ۚ kadhālika najziẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: فَبَدَأَ بِأَوْعِيَتِهِمْ قَبْلَ وِعَآءِ أَخِيهِ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَخْرَجَهَا مِن وِعَآءِ أَخِيهِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كِدْنَا لِيُوسُفَ ۖ مَا كَانَ لِيَأْخُذَ أَخَاهُ فِى دِينِ ٱلْمَلِكِ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ نَرْفَعُ دَرَجَـٰتٍ مَّن نَّشَآءُ ۗ وَفَوْقَ كُلِّ ذِى عِلْمٍ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Then he (Joseph) began the search with their bags before his brother's bag, then he produced it from his brother's bag. Thus did We contrive for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother according to the king's law unless Allah willed. We raise by grades (of mercy) whom We will, and over every lord of knowledge there is one more knowing.
rows.transliteration: fabada-a bi-aw`iyatihim qabla wi`ā-i akhīhi thummas-takhrajahā min wi`ā-i akhīh ۚ kadhālika kidnā liyūsuf ۖ mā kāna liya-khudha akhāhu fī dīnil maliki illā an yashā-allāh ۚ narfa`u darajātin man nashā-u ۗ wafawqa kulli dhī `il-min `alīm

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِن يَسْرِقْ فَقَدْ سَرَقَ أَخٌ لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ فَأَسَرَّهَا يُوسُفُ فِى نَفْسِهِۦ وَلَمْ يُبْدِهَا لَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ أَنتُمْ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا ۖ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: They said: If he stealeth, a brother of his stole before. But Joseph kept it secret in his soul and revealed it not unto them. He said (within himself): Ye are in worse case, and Allah knoweth best (the truth of) that which ye allege.
rows.transliteration: qālū in yasriq faqad saraqa akhul lahu min qabl ۚ fa-asarrahā yūsufu fī nafsihi walam yubdihā lahum ۚ qāla antum sharrun makānā ۖ wallāhu a`lamu bimā taṣifūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْعَزِيزُ إِنَّ لَهُۥٓ أَبًا شَيْخًا كَبِيرًا فَخُذْ أَحَدَنَا مَكَانَهُۥٓ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَىٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: They said: O ruler of the land! Lo! he hath a very aged father, so take one of us instead of him. Lo! we behold thee of those who do kindness.
rows.transliteration: qālū yā-ayyuhal `azīzu inna lahu aban shaykhan kabīran fakhudh aḥadanā makānah ۖ innā narāka minal muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ أَن نَّأْخُذَ إِلَّا مَن وَجَدْنَا مَتَـٰعَنَا عِندَهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.
rows.transliteration: qāla ma`ādhallāhi an na-khudha illā man wajadnā matā`anā `indahu innā idhal laẓālimūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا ٱسْتَيْـَٔسُوا۟ مِنْهُ خَلَصُوا۟ نَجِيًّا ۖ قَالَ كَبِيرُهُمْ أَلَمْ تَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ أَبَاكُمْ قَدْ أَخَذَ عَلَيْكُم مَّوْثِقًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ مَا فَرَّطتُمْ فِى يُوسُفَ ۖ فَلَنْ أَبْرَحَ ٱلْأَرْضَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْذَنَ لِىٓ أَبِىٓ أَوْ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ لِى ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
rows.translation: So, When they despaired of (moving) him, they conferred together apart. The eldest of them said: Know ye not how your father took an undertaking from you in Allah's name and how ye failed in the case of Joseph aforetime? Therefore I shall not go forth from the land until my father giveth leave or Allah judgeth for me. He is the Best of Judges.
rows.transliteration: falammas-tay-asū minhu khalaṣū najiyyā ۖ qāla kabīruhum alam ta`lamū anna abākum qad akhadha `alaykum mawthiqan minallāhi wa min qablu mā farraṭtum fī yūsuf ۖ falan abraḥal-arḍa ḥattā ya-dhana lī abī aw yaḥkumallāhu lī ۖ wahuwa khayrul ḥākimīn

rows.arabic: ٱرْجِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَبِيكُمْ فَقُولُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَآ إِنَّ ٱبْنَكَ سَرَقَ وَمَا شَهِدْنَآ إِلَّا بِمَا عَلِمْنَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِلْغَيْبِ حَـٰفِظِينَ
rows.translation: Return unto your father and say: O our father! Lo! thy son hath stolen. We testify only to that which we know; we are not guardians of the Unseen.
rows.transliteration: irji`ū ilā abīkum faqūlū yā-abānā innab-naka saraqa wa mā shahidnā illā bimā `alimnā wa mā kunnā lilghaybi ḥāfiẓīn

rows.arabic: وَسْـَٔلِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ ٱلَّتِى كُنَّا فِيهَا وَٱلْعِيرَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَقْبَلْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
rows.translation: Ask the township where we were, and the caravan with which we travelled hither. Lo! we speak the truth.
rows.transliteration: was-alil qaryatal latī kunnā fīhā wal `īral latī aqbalnā fīhā ۖ wa innā laṣādiqūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًا ۖ فَصَبْرٌ جَمِيلٌ ۖ عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَأْتِيَنِى بِهِمْ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: (And when they came unto their father and had spoken thus to him) he said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience! It may be that Allah will bring them all unto me. Lo! He, only He, is the Knower, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: qāla bal sawwalat lakum anfusukum amrā ۖ faṣabrun jamīl ۖ `asallāhu an ya-tiyanī bihim jamī`ā ۚ innahu huwal `alīmul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَسَفَىٰ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَٱبْيَضَّتْ عَيْنَاهُ مِنَ ٱلْحُزْنِ فَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: And he turned away from them and said: Alas, my grief for Joseph! And his eyes were whitened with the sorrow that he was suppressing.
rows.transliteration: watawallā `anhum waqāla yā-asafā `alā yūsufa wabyaḍḍat `aynāhu minal ḥuzni fahuwa kaẓīm

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ تَفْتَؤُا۟ تَذْكُرُ يُوسُفَ حَتَّىٰ تَكُونَ حَرَضًا أَوْ تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْهَـٰلِكِينَ
rows.translation: They said: By Allah, thou wilt never cease remembering Joseph till thy health is ruined or thou art of those who perish!
rows.transliteration: qālū tallāhi tafta-u tadhkuru yūsufa ḥattā takūna ḥaraḍan aw takūna minal hālikīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَشْكُوا۟ بَثِّى وَحُزْنِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: He said: I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.
rows.transliteration: qāla innamā ashkū bathhī waḥuznī ilallāhi wa-a`lamu minallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىَّ ٱذْهَبُوا۟ فَتَحَسَّسُوا۟ مِن يُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ وَلَا تَا۟يْـَٔسُوا۟ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَا۟يْـَٔسُ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: Go, O my sons, and ascertain concerning Joseph and his brother, and despair not of the Spirit of Allah. Lo! none despaireth of the Spirit of Allah save disbelieving folk.
rows.transliteration: yābaniyyadh-habū fataḥassasū min yūsufa wa-akhīhi walā tay-asū min rawḥillāh ۖ innahu lā yay-asu min rawḥillāhi illal-qawmul kāfirūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْعَزِيزُ مَسَّنَا وَأَهْلَنَا ٱلضُّرُّ وَجِئْنَا بِبِضَـٰعَةٍ مُّزْجَىٰةٍ فَأَوْفِ لَنَا ٱلْكَيْلَ وَتَصَدَّقْ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَجْزِى ٱلْمُتَصَدِّقِينَ
rows.translation: And when they came (again) before him (Joseph) they said: O ruler! Misfortune hath touched us and our folk, and we bring but poor merchandise, so fill for us the measure and be charitable unto us. Lo! Allah will requite the charitable,
rows.transliteration: falammā dakhalū `alayhi qālū yā-ayyuhal `azīzu massanā wa-ahlanaḍ ḍurru waji-nā bibiḍā`atim muzjātin fa-awfi lanal kayla wataṣaddaq `alaynā ۖ innallāha yajzil mutaṣaddiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ عَلِمْتُم مَّا فَعَلْتُم بِيُوسُفَ وَأَخِيهِ إِذْ أَنتُمْ جَـٰهِلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: Know ye what ye did unto Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?
rows.transliteration: qāla hal `alimtum mā fa`altum biyūsufa wa-akhīhi idh antum jāhilūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَءِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يُوسُفُ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ يُوسُفُ وَهَـٰذَآ أَخِى ۖ قَدْ مَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: They said: Is it indeed thou who art Joseph? He said: I am Joseph and this is my brother. Allah hath shown us favour. Lo! he who wardeth off (evil) and endureth (findeth favour); for lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the kindly.
rows.transliteration: qālū a-innaka la-anta yūsuf ۖ qāla ana yūsufu wahādhā akhī ۖ qad mannallāhu `alaynā ۖ innahu man yattaqi wayaṣbir fa-innallāha lā yuḍī`u ajral muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ ءَاثَرَكَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَإِن كُنَّا لَخَـٰطِـِٔينَ
rows.translation: They said: By Allah, verily Allah hath preferred thee above us, and we were indeed sinful.
rows.transliteration: qālū tallāhi laqad ātharakallāhu `alaynā wa in kunnā lakhāṭi-īn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَا تَثْرِيبَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ يَغْفِرُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
rows.translation: He said: Have no fear this day! May Allah forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
rows.transliteration: qāla lā tathrība `alaykumul yawm ۖ yaghfirullāhu lakum ۖ wahuwa arḥamur rāḥimīn

rows.arabic: ٱذْهَبُوا۟ بِقَمِيصِى هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقُوهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِ أَبِى يَأْتِ بَصِيرًا وَأْتُونِى بِأَهْلِكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father's face, he will become (again) a seer; and come to me with all your folk.
rows.transliteration: idh-habū biqamīṣī hādhā fa-alqūhu `alā wajhi abī ya-ti baṣīran wa-tūnī bi-ahlikum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا فَصَلَتِ ٱلْعِيرُ قَالَ أَبُوهُمْ إِنِّى لَأَجِدُ رِيحَ يُوسُفَ ۖ لَوْلَآ أَن تُفَنِّدُونِ
rows.translation: When the caravan departed their father had said: Truly I am conscious of the breath of Joseph, though ye call me dotard.
rows.transliteration: walammā faṣalatil `īru qāla abūhum innī la-ajidu rīḥa yūsuf ۖ lawlā an tufannidūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَٱللَّهِ إِنَّكَ لَفِى ضَلَـٰلِكَ ٱلْقَدِيمِ
rows.translation: (Those around him) said: By Allah, lo! thou art in thine old aberration.
rows.transliteration: qālū tallāhi innaka lafī ḍalālikal qadīm

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَن جَآءَ ٱلْبَشِيرُ أَلْقَىٰهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦ فَٱرْتَدَّ بَصِيرًا ۖ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Then, when the bearer of glad tidings came, he laid it on his face and he became a seer once more. He said: Said I not unto you that I know from Allah that which ye know not?
rows.transliteration: falammā an jā-al bashīru alqāhu `alā wajhihi fartadda baṣīrā ۖ qāla alam aqul lakum innī a`lamu minallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا ٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا خَـٰطِـِٔينَ
rows.translation: They said: O our father! Ask forgiveness of our sins for us, for lo! we were sinful.
rows.transliteration: qālū yā-abānas-taghfir lanā dhunūbanā innā kunnā khāṭi-īn

rows.arabic: قَالَ سَوْفَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكُمْ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
rows.translation: He said: I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: qāla sawfa astaghfiru lakum rabbī ۖ innahu huwal ghafūrur raḥīm

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ ءَاوَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ أَبَوَيْهِ وَقَالَ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مِصْرَ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ءَامِنِينَ
rows.translation: And when they came in before Joseph, he took his parents unto him, and said: Come into Egypt safe, if Allah will!
rows.transliteration: falammā dakhalū `alā yūsufa āwā ilayhi abawayhi waqālad-khulū miṣra in shā-allāhu āminīn

rows.arabic: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيْهِ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ وَخَرُّوا۟ لَهُۥ سُجَّدًا ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ هَـٰذَا تَأْوِيلُ رُءْيَـٰىَ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَعَلَهَا رَبِّى حَقًّا ۖ وَقَدْ أَحْسَنَ بِىٓ إِذْ أَخْرَجَنِى مِنَ ٱلسِّجْنِ وَجَآءَ بِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْبَدْوِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن نَّزَغَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَ إِخْوَتِىٓ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَطِيفٌ لِّمَا يَشَآءُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: And he placed his parents on the dais and they fell down before him prostrate, and he said: O my father! This is the interpretation of my dream of old. My Lord hath made it true, and He hath shown me kindness, since He took me out of the prison and hath brought you from the desert after Satan had made strife between me and my brethren. Lo! my Lord is tender unto whom He will. He is the Knower, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: warafa`a abawayhi `alal-`arshi wakharrū lahu sujjadā ۖ waqāla yā-abati hādhā ta-wīlu ru-yāya min qablu qad ja`alahā rabbī ḥaqqā ۖ waqad aḥsana bī idh akhrajanī minas sijni wajā-a bikum minal badwi min ba`di an nazaghash shayṭānu baynī wabayna ikhwatī ۚ inna rabbī laṭīful limā yashā-u ۚ innahu huwal `alīmul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: رَبِّ قَدْ ءَاتَيْتَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُلْكِ وَعَلَّمْتَنِى مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ فَاطِرَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَنتَ وَلِىِّۦ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۖ تَوَفَّنِى مُسْلِمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: O my Lord! Thou hast given me (something) of sovereignty and hast taught me (something) of the interpretation of events - Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protecting Guardian in the world and the Hereafter. Make me to die muslim (unto Thee), and join me to the righteous.
rows.transliteration: rabbi qad ātaytanī minal mulki wa`allamtanī min ta-wīlil-aḥādīth ۚ fāṭiras samāwāti wal-arḍi anta waliyyiy fid dunyā wal-ākhirah ۖ tawaffanī musliman wa-alḥiqnī biṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ أَجْمَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ يَمْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad). Thou wast not present with them when they fixed their plan and they were scheming.
rows.transliteration: dhālika min anbā-il ghaybi nūḥīhi ilayk ۖ wa mā kunta ladayhim idh ajma`ū amrahum wahum yamkurūn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَوْ حَرَصْتَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And though thou try much, most men will not believe.
rows.transliteration: wa mā aktharun nāsi walaw ḥaraṣta bimu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Thou askest them no fee for it. It is naught else than a reminder unto the peoples.
rows.transliteration: wa mā tas-aluhum `alayhi min ajr ۚ in huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّنْ ءَايَةٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ يَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهَا وَهُمْ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: How many a portent is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by with face averted!
rows.transliteration: waka-ayyin min āyatin fis samāwāti wal-arḍi yamurrūna `alayhā wahum `anhā mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يُؤْمِنُ أَكْثَرُهُم بِٱللَّهِ إِلَّا وَهُم مُّشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: And most of them believe not in Allah except that they attribute partners (unto Him).
rows.transliteration: wa mā yu-minu aktharuhum billāhi illā wahum mushrikūn

rows.arabic: أَفَأَمِنُوٓا۟ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ غَـٰشِيَةٌ مِّنْ عَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Deem they themselves secure from the coming on them of a pall of Allah's punishment, or the coming of the Hour suddenly while they are unaware?
rows.transliteration: afa-aminū an ta-tiyahum ghāshiyatun min `adhābillāhi aw ta-tiyahumus sā`atu baghtatan wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ هَـٰذِهِۦ سَبِيلِىٓ أَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ عَلَىٰ بَصِيرَةٍ أَنَا۠ وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَنِى ۖ وَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: Say: This is my Way: I call on Allah with sure knowledge. I and whosoever followeth me - Glory be to Allah! - and I am not of the idolaters.
rows.transliteration: qul hādhihi sabīlī ad`ū ilallāh ۚ `alā baṣīratin ana wa manit-taba`anī ۖ wasubḥānallāhi wa mā ana minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُّوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ ۗ أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۗ وَلَدَارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best. Have ye then no sense? -
rows.transliteration: wa mā arsalnā min qablika illā rijālan nūḥī ilayhim min ahlil qurā ۗ afalam yasīrū fil-arḍi fayanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul ladhīna min qablihim ۗ waladārul-ākhirati khayrul lilladhīnat-taqaw ۗ afalā ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا ٱسْتَيْـَٔسَ ٱلرُّسُلُ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ كُذِبُوا۟ جَآءَهُمْ نَصْرُنَا فَنُجِّىَ مَن نَّشَآءُ ۖ وَلَا يُرَدُّ بَأْسُنَا عَنِ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: Till, when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, then came unto them Our help, and whom We would was saved. And Our wrath cannot be warded from the guilty.
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhas-tay-asar rusulu waẓannū annahum qad kudhibū jā-ahum naṣrunā fanujjiya man nashā-u ۖ walā yuraddu ba-sunā `anil qawmil mujrimīn

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ كَانَ فِى قَصَصِهِمْ عِبْرَةٌ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ ۗ مَا كَانَ حَدِيثًا يُفْتَرَىٰ وَلَـٰكِن تَصْدِيقَ ٱلَّذِى بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَتَفْصِيلَ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: In their history verily there is a lesson for men of understanding. It is no invented story but a confirmation of the existing (Scripture) and a detailed explanation of everything, and a guidance and a mercy for folk who believe.
rows.transliteration: laqad kāna fī qaṣaṣihim `ibratun li-ulil-albāb ۗ mā kāna ḥadīthan yuftarā walākin taṣdīqal ladhī bayna yadayhi watafṣīla kulli shay-in wahudan waraḥmatan liqawmiy yu-minūn
